title: The Wal-Mart Effect: How the World's Most Powerful Company Really Works--and How It's Transforming the American Economy
description: An award-winning senior editor at Fast Company evaluates the ways in which the world's largest retail company and employer affects everyday life on a global level, in an account that reveals the radical ways in which the company impacts American economics, the workforce, and the environment. 50,000 first printing.
author: Charles Fishman
